notes.text:
A vulnerability in affected devices could allow an attacker to perform a denial ofservice attack if a large amount of Profinet Discovery and Configuration Protocol (DCP) reset packets is sent to the affected devices.

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

references.summary: SSA-599968: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Profinet Devices - HTML Version
SSA-599968: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Profinet Devices - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-599968: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Profinet Devices

revision_history.summary: Added solution for SCALANCE XR-300WG, SCALANCE XB-200, SCALANCE XP-200, SCALANCE XC-200, SCALANCE XF-200 and EK-ERTEC 200P
Added solution for SCALANCE X-200 switch family and SIMATIC NET CM 1542-1
Added solution for SIMATIC PROFINET Driver
Clarified that no remediation is planned for SCALANCE W700 and SCALANCE W1700, SIMATIC CP 1604, SIMATIC CP 1616, and SIMATIC CP 1626
Added solution for SCALANCE X-300 switch family (incl. X408 and SIPLUS NET variants) and SCALANCE W-1700 (11ac) family
Added fix for SIMATIC CFU PA/DIQ; fix planned for SIMATIC IE/PB-LINK
Added fix for SCALANCE XR-300WG family (was no longer listed since V1.5 of the SSA); consolidated and expanded list of affected SCALANCE product families, incl. MLFB information
Clarified that no fix is planned for SIMATIC IE/PB-LINK; Added CVSSv4.0 vector

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: Affected devices contain a vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated attacker to trigger a denial of service condition. The vulnerability can be triggered if a large amount of DCP reset packets are sent to the device.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Block incoming Profinet Discovery and Configuration Protocol (DCP) packets (Ethertype 0x8892, Frame-ID: 0xfefe) from untrusted networks
Disable Profinet in products, where Profinet is optional and not used in your environment
